name: Ext_R3_Sequence_referenceSeq
title: Cross-version Extension for R3.Sequence.referenceSeq for use in FHIR R5
description: This cross-version extension represents Sequence.referenceSeq from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Sequence|3.0.2 for use in FHIR R5.

element.definition: A sequence that is used as a reference to describe variants that are present in a sequence analyzed.
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.referenceSeq` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.definition: Structural unit composed of a nucleic acid molecule which controls its own replication through the interaction of specific proteins at one or more origins of replication ([SO:0000340](http://www.sequenceontology.org/browser/current_svn/term/SO:0000340)).
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.referenceSeq` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.definition: Structural unit composed of a nucleic acid molecule which controls its own replication through the interaction of specific proteins at one or more origins of replication ([SO:0000340](http://www.sequenceontology.org/browser/current_svn/term/SO:0000340)).
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.referenceSeq` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.short: The Genome Build used for reference, following GRCh build versions e.g. 'GRCh 37'
element.definition: The Genome Build used for reference, following GRCh build versions e.g. 'GRCh 37'.  Version number must be included if a versioned release of a primary build was used.
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.referenceSeq` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.short: The Genome Build used for reference, following GRCh build versions e.g. 'GRCh 37'
element.definition: The Genome Build used for reference, following GRCh build versions e.g. 'GRCh 37'.  Version number must be included if a versioned release of a primary build was used.
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.referenceSeq` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.definition: Reference identifier of reference sequence submitted to NCBI. It must match the type in the Sequence.type field. For example, the prefix, “NG_” identifies reference sequence for genes, “NM_” for messenger RNA transcripts, and “NP_” for amino acid sequences.
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.referenceSeq` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.definition: Reference identifier of reference sequence submitted to NCBI. It must match the type in the Sequence.type field. For example, the prefix, “NG_” identifies reference sequence for genes, “NM_” for messenger RNA transcripts, and “NP_” for amino acid sequences.
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.referenceSeq` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.short: A Pointer to another Sequence entity as reference sequence
element.definition: `MolecularSequence.referenceSeq` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.short: A Pointer to another Sequence entity as reference sequence
element.definition: `MolecularSequence.referenceSeq` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.short: A string to represent reference sequence
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.referenceSeq` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.short: A string to represent reference sequence
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.referenceSeq` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.definition: Directionality of DNA sequence. Available values are "1" for the plus strand (5' to 3')/Watson/Sense/positive  and "-1" for the minus strand(3' to 5')/Crick/Antisense/negative.
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.referenceSeq` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.definition: Directionality of DNA sequence. Available values are "1" for the plus strand (5' to 3')/Watson/Sense/positive  and "-1" for the minus strand(3' to 5')/Crick/Antisense/negative.
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.referenceSeq` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.short: Start position of the window on the  reference sequence
element.definition: Start position of the window on the reference sequence. If the coordinate system is either 0-based or 1-based, then start position is inclusive.
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.referenceSeq` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.short: Start position of the window on the  reference sequence
element.definition: Start position of the window on the reference sequence. If the coordinate system is either 0-based or 1-based, then start position is inclusive.
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.referenceSeq` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.short: End position of the window on the reference sequence
element.definition: End position of the window on the reference sequence. If the coordinate system is 0-based then end is is exclusive and does not include the last position. If the coordinate system is 1-base, then end is inclusive and includes the last position.
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.referenceSeq` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.short: End position of the window on the reference sequence
element.definition: End position of the window on the reference sequence. If the coordinate system is 0-based then end is is exclusive and does not include the last position. If the coordinate system is 1-base, then end is inclusive and includes the last position.
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.referenceSeq` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence
